title: Glaxe
author: Glaxe
content: We all know Binance is one of the best exchange in the world and there is a button called P2P Trade and there one can trade in their own local currency. I don't know how to do that so I'm asking for help from everyone. I hope you can explain me in detail.

comments.body: Quote from: Glaxe on October 10, 2023, 03:07:10 PMWe all know Binance is one of the best exchange in the world and there is a button called P2P Trade and there one can trade in their own local currency. I don't know how to do that so I'm asking for help from everyone. I hope you can explain me in detail.I am explaining to you very simply.First of all if you want to trade P2P you must Binance or Kucoin exchange there should be exchanges and even they should be verified so you can feel free to convert your dollars or different crypto currencies to your own local currency by going to the p2p option.Hopefully you will understand better if you follow these steps.I mention them for your understanding.If you want to trade Binance P2P then you must verify your exchange because without verification it is not possible to trade P2P.1. First you go to your Binance exchange then there you will see something like this.2. After this page is opened you will see wallet written below click on it.3. After clicking on the option to write the wallet, you will see the option to write the deposit.4. Clicking on the deposit button will open a page like this and a search button will appear.You just type the name of the currency you want to convert into your own money in the search button and then select that currency.I am giving an example, because if you want to deposit USDT then you have to select any network either BSC or Ethereum network.It goes without saying that the coins you deposit will have their own network and you must selecte that network before depositing.5. If your deposit is successful, you need to transfer them to Funding Wallet.You can do it like this.After clicking on the transfer button, your page will show like this and you will enter the currency you want to transfer here and click on the confirm button.6. Then you need to come back to your exchange's home page and you will see there is a button called P2P Trading and you click on that.7. P2P After clicking on, a page like this will show in front of you You will then click on the Sell button.After clicking you will see something like this.If you click on the page that I have marked on the page that you see, it will show the currency of different countries, from there you can select the currency of the country in which you live.8. After selecting your own country and currency you will come to this page and you will see it says select your payment method and click there to add your own account.Then you will see it written below sell with zero fee after clicking there when the buyer you sell to will pay you.Then you check it well and then release it.This way you can trade P2P on your Binance Exchange.I have discussed it in detail like this for ease of understanding.

They're not the best in security, Binance exchange is a centralized exchange and when we want to trade P2P transaction, centralized exchange are not the best exchange we should be using instead we should using exchange that are decentralized. If you want to trade P2P and enjoy full decentralization make use of https://bisq.network. You can make use of Binance exchange for your regular trading if you'll be comfortable submitting your documents for KYC but if you're not comfortable and value your privacy, you should make use of other exchange that don't require KYC for trading and withdrawals. We have many decentralized exchange that you can use and they can be found here; https://www.coingecko.com/en/exchanges/decentralized

I hope you can explain me in detail.It is true it have some pseudo p2p network, to do p2p trades you need to enter to https://c2c.binance.com/ logged in your account.Select buy the token or coin that you want to buy, the currency that you want use (your local currencty)Select the best offer that fit your needs, check reputation of the seller and time of response. Select how much of that token or coin you want to buy and place an ORDERSend him the payment to the account that is listed in the page with your local bank, usually bank transfer are allowed, but this may vary from one country to another.wait for him to confirm the transactions.If there is some problem you always can request support from bianance.Regards!

I don't know how to do that so I'm asking for help from everyone. I hope you can explain me in detail.First of all, the p2p trading feature on Binance is available for KYC verified users only and if you haven't completed your KYC already then you'll have to complete your KYC first. Once your KYC is completed then you click on this link Trade p2p Binance URL and then select your local currency from the available currencies and also select the payment method. Now that you have selected the above now you'll see the people who are offering their exchange services and place your trade. If you want to sell your crypto than click on the sell button and if you want to buy crypto then click on buy button. Once you decided that which route you wanna go then you should find all those merchants who are offering their buying and selling services and there you can place your buy or sell order with the merchants and once you sent or received the payment in your local currency then you can complete the trade and leave feedback.

comments.body: Quote from: CryptopreneurBrainboss on October 10, 2023, 03:35:29 PMBinance exchange isn't the best It is not best for P2P trades especially, where we can find lot of scams like fake payment proofs, funds transferred from hacked accounts and a lot others so who ever using p2p exchanges for crypto to fiat trades should be very careful while choosing the trading partner irrespective of the platform cause we are going to deal with another individual so we may have to share sensitive personal information with them if needed and that person is collecting those data with bad intention then we will have issues.Here is an article explains about Common Scams on Binance P2P|Protecting Yourself from Scammers on Binance P2P, so OP take a look at this before starting your p2p trading journey.

Binance have problem with downrating merchants that does not meet their requirements every week, if you don't make trades often, they may flash you down.
